Rambledocs.Component: This doesn't work in CLISP because typep doesn't work properly in CLISP. We could use rtest-any-valid-return-p instead but that doesn't work in Elisp. So I bandaged it in rtest-lisp.lisp, but the real fix is to use a better inferior Lisp.

Not quite an entry point, but usable. rtest-entry.el and rtest-cl-entry would manage this if it were to become frequently used.
This can't have an interactive spec to acquire the symbol because it services Common Lisp too.
